text: Short order cooking is common at greasy spoon and diner restaurants. Short order cooking, in the restaurant business, is the preparation of foods that are quick to cook. Wayne Gisslen, Mary Ellen Griffin, Professional Cooking for Canadian Chefs, p. 10, , p. 10 This includes fried, broiled, griddled, and other items. Many small restaurants have only short-order items. A cook responsible for short order cooking is a short order cook. ==Notes== Category:Cooking Category:Restaurant terminology
title: Short order cooking
